Readthrough mechanism: insertion of a base in anticodon
Mutational position of sup-tRNA: SUF2:The insertion of a G-C base pair at a position in the gene that corresponds to the anticodon loop of the proline tRNA results in the replacement of the wild-type anticodon AGG by a AGGG four-base anticodon which enables the tRNA to suppress the CCCU four-base codons generated as the result of the his4-712 and his4-713 frameshift mutations.

Readthrough mechanism: a base mutation outside the anticodon
Mutational position of sup-tRNA:
Suppressor mutations in the SUF7 and SUF8 genes result in G-to-U base substitutions at position 39 that disrupted the normal G·C base pairing in the last base pair of the anticodon stem adjacent to the anticodon loop. 
These anticodon stem mutations might alter the size of the anticodon loop and permit the use of a UGGG sequence within the loop to read 4-base proline codons.

Readthrough mechanism: insertion of a base in anticodon
Mutational position of sup-tRNA: sufD:the frameshift suppressor mutation produce a glycine tRNA with the nucleotide quadruplet CCCC at the anticodon position, instead of the triplet CCC found in wildtype.
